content.description:
This climbs the right side of The Tombstone. It is a little easier than

Beggar's Tomb

. The first half of the route is protected by 5 bolts, although the first one is about 20 feet up. After clipping the last bolt, stay to the right of the small, right-facing dihedral. Bring some smaller-sized cams and nuts to protect this top section of the route. After the last bolt, the climbing gets easier like 5.8, and I chose to run it out to the anchors, but it is a big run out, so gear would be recommended.
content.protection: 5 or 6 bolts and some smaller-sized cams and or nuts, or just run it out to the anchors.
content.location: It is on the right side of the Tombstone.

content.description: Start off on the left side of the Tombstone, and climb the left-facing dihedral. I placed a gold cam and a small stopper. Once I clipped the first bolt at about 30 feet up, I climbed out of the dihedral and onto the face. The rest of this climb is protected by 5 or 6 bolts to chain anchors. The crux is pulling some small crimps in between bolts 4 and 5 at the bulge.
content.protection: A couple cams or stoppers and then about 6 bolts to the anchors. Bring a 70 meter rope. A 60m might make it.
content.location: It is left and up the trail from Endless Wall.
